edu.wpi.first.wpilibj

Class BackgroundCalibratingGyro

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SensorBase
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Gyro
        • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.BackgroundCalibratingGyro
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.livewindow.LiveWindowSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class BackgroundCalibratingGyro
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Gyro
    Use a rate gyro to return the robots heading relative to a starting position. The Gyro class tracks the robots heading based on the starting position. As the robot rotates the new heading is computed by integrating the rate of rotation returned by the sensor. When the class is instantiated, it does a short calibration routine where it samples the gyro while at rest to determine the default offset. The BackgroundCalibratingGyro also calibrates when disabled, as long as calibrateGyro is called. startGyro should be called when first enabled to finish the calibration process. This calibration value is subtracted from each sample to determine the heading.
    Author:
    Joe Ross, Team 330

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackgroundCalibratingGyro

        public BackgroundCalibratingGyro(int channel)
        Gyro constructor with only a channel. Use the default analog module slot.
        Parameters:

      • BackgroundCalibratingGyro

        public BackgroundCalibratingGyro(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AnalogInput channel)
        Gyro constructor with a precreated analog channel object. Use this constructor when the analog channel needs to be shared. There is no reference counting when an AnalogChannel is passed to the gyro.
        Parameters:
        channel - The AnalogChannel object that the gyro is connected to.

    • Method Detail

      • initGyro

        public void initGyro()
        Initialize the gyro. Calibrate the gyro by running for a number of samples and computing the center value for this part. Then use the center value as the Accumulator center value for subsequent measurements. It's important to make sure that the robot is not moving while the centering calculations are in progress, this is typically done when the robot is first turned on while it's sitting at rest before the competition starts.
        Overrides:
        initGyro in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Gyro

      • calibrateGyro

        public void calibrateGyro()
        Calibrate the gyro in the background. calibrateGyro should be called when disabled.

      • startGyro

        public void startGyro()
        Use the latest gyro data to complete the calibration. This should be called when transitioning to enabled (for example teleopInit and autonomousInit. If the less then 5 seconds elapsed from the time calibrateGyro is first called and startGyro is called, the previous calibration value is used.

      • restartCalibration

        public void restartCalibration()
        Restart the calibration process. Calibration will stop when startGyro() is called.
